section_title: Arthroscopic Capsular Release/Lysis of Adhesions (Evidence: pg no: 12, L488)
names: Arthroscopic Capsular Release (Evidence: pg no: 12, L488)
Lysis of Adhesions (Evidence: pg no: 12, L488)
description: Arthroscopic capsular release/lysis of adhesions for chronic refractory adhesive capsulitis/arthrofibrosis with specific range of motion requirements (Evidence: pg no: 12, L490-L507)
scope: Arthroscopic capsular release/lysis of adhesions for adhesive capsulitis/arthrofibrosis (Evidence: pg no: 12, L490-L492)

documentation: Function-limiting pain for at least six (6) months in duration (Evidence: pg no: 12, L494-L496)
Individual demonstrates functionally limited and painful global loss of active and passive range of motion of at least 50% when compared to the non-involved side (Evidence: pg no: 12, L497-L499)

Failure of provider-directed non-surgical management for at least three (3) months in duration, including a combination of anti-inflammatory medication, cortisone injection, and a trial of physical therapy (Evidence: pg no: 12, L500-L503)

Other potential diagnostic conditions including fracture, thoracic outlet syndrome, brachial plexus disorders, referred neck pain, cervical radiculopathy, and advanced glenohumeral osteoarthritis have been excluded (Evidence: pg no: 12, L504-L507)

exclusions: Any other indication or condition (Evidence: pg no: 12, L509-L510)

codes.description: Capsular contracture release (e.g. Sever type procedure) (Evidence: pg no: 13, L525)
Arthroscopy, shoulder, surgical; with lysis and resection of adhesions, with or without manipulation (Evidence: pg no: 14, L580-L581)

notes: Requires at least 50% loss of range of motion and specific conservative management including anti-inflammatory medication, cortisone injection, and physical therapy (Evidence: pg no: 12, L498-L503)
